t: For the director of music. A psalm of David.
The*pn king rejoices in your strength, Lord.*s How*ld great is his joy in the victories you give!
You*pn have granted him his heart’s desire and*ld have not withheld the request of his lips.
You*ln came to greet him with rich blessings and*ld placed a crown of pure gold on his head.
He*ln asked you for life, and you gave it to him— length*ld of days, for ever and ever.
Through*ln the victories you gave, his glory is great; you*ld have bestowed on him splendor and majesty.
Surely*ln you have granted him unending blessings and*ld made him glad with the joy of your presence.
For*ln the king trusts in the Lord;*s through*ld the unfailing love of the Most High he*ld will not be shaken.
Your*pn hand will lay hold on all your enemies; your*ld right hand will seize your foes.
When*ln you appear for battle, you*ld will burn them up as in a blazing furnace. The*ln Lord*s will swallow them up in his wrath, and*ld his fire will consume them.
You*ln will destroy their descendants from the earth, their*ld posterity from mankind.
Though*ln they plot evil against you and*ld devise wicked schemes, they cannot succeed.
You*ln will make them turn their backs when*ld you aim at them with drawn bow.
Be*pn exalted in your strength, Lord;*s we*ld will sing and praise your might.
